headline: Baked Ziti with Sausage
description: Baked ziti with sausage cooked until bubbly with spaghetti sauce, cheese, and sausage. This is a pasta recipe with delicious, comforting flavor.

video.description: A saucy, cheesy and tempting pasta bake!
video.name: Baked Ziti with Sausage

name: Baked Ziti with Sausage
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Italian cheese blend

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in ziti and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through but still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain well.
While pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add sausage; cook and stir until brown, about 10 minutes. Drain sausage and set aside.
Stir together ricotta, onion, egg, garlic, and oregano in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in pasta, sausage, salt, pepper, and the half jar of spaghetti sauce; mix well.

Cover the bottom of the prepared baking dish with 1/3 of the full jar spaghetti sauce. Layer with 1/2 of the pasta mixture, 1/2 of the remaining spaghetti sauce, and 1/2 of the shredded cheese. Repeat layers once more using remaining pasta, sauce, and cheese. Sprinkle basil over top and cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes. Uncover; return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, 5 to 10 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: It was very good. Only issue was that 30 minutes in the oven didn’t heat it through— we had to microwave our individual servings. But that was easily remedied, and I would definitely make it again.

I saved this recipe years ago and still it's my go-to for any baked pasta- ziti, rigatoni, penne etc. I made two batches for church group today -one regular and one gluten free. I'm on the website now because I had several people Ask Me For the Recipe! I tweak it a little each time of course. Today I added a little more garlic, and used turkey sausage with the gluten free dish. Also some red pepper flakes. But that's why this recipe is so excellent! It's never failed me . I'd give it 10 stars if that was possible.
Overall pretty good, but the onions should be cooked with the meat and maybe use only half.
This was really tasty. I made it with vegan sausage. Next time, I'll saute the onions because they were a little too crunchy.

The entire family loved it, and that’s really hard to do with 5 people ranging from 11-81! I will definitely make it again. I will however cut back the onion to half. I love onion but it was a little heavy on that.
My resident Italian enjoyed it. You definitely want to cook the onions and garlic with the sausage to avoid crunchy ziti. Otherwise good recipe.

I added ground beef with the sausage. Cook the onions in with the meat. Drained and added the sauce. Added the ricotta cheese to warm sauce. Added the pasta. Spayed the pan, poured in the 13by 9 baking dish, sprinkled the cheese on top
My friends keep asking me to make this again. I had trouble finding Italian blend cheese so I just used mozzarella with a bit of parmigiana and it turned out great!

Instead of using prepared sauce I always make my own using crushed and whole tomatoes, more than the amount of sauce in the recipe. Also I sauté the onion (it is raw if you don't), garlic and red sweet pepper along with additional herbs and put into the sauce. I also prefer the hot Italian sausage. My wife loves this so I make it regularly.
Holy crap this is soooo good! Even my picky eaters and non pasta lovers loved it, thank you so much. It’s definitely gonna be a weekly dinner at our house too now

So easy and super yummy! I added 1/3 cup grated parmesan & romano and about 1 cup grated mozzarella to the middle layer and top. Be sure to tent the foil when baking so it doesn’t stick to the melted cheese. I’d also suggest par cooking or sautéing the minced onions, as they were a tad bit undercooked . I’m going to double the recipe next time because there wasn't any left for leftovers!

Very good recipe. We used really good spicy sauce and fresh parsley. We also use 1/2 ground beef and 1/2 sausage. Wish we would have cooked the onion with the meat because it was a little crunchy. But overall, we are pleased with the outcome.
Simple and delicious. The whole family loves this dish!

Great recipe and easy to follow. I made some minor changes by adding additional sauce and 16 ounces of mozzarella and mixed Italian cheeses. I'm freezing 1/2 of the ziti to have for dinner another time.

Basic base for what could be a good recipe, but needs tweaked, and I should have known better. The onions and garlic come out raw, crunchy, and give it an unpleasant spice.

Four changes:
Sweat the onions and garlic before mixing
Add 6 ounces more sauce (3 & 3 to the layers)
Add 2 ounces more cheese on top
Bake covered for 45 minutes, then uncovered for 15

Three suggestions:
Spicy sausage instead of mild
Use a quality sauce - Classico Tomato Basil is my go-to
Add a little parmigiano reggiano to the top (2 ounces, maybe)
Just like lasagna but without all the work...will make again many times. The only thing I did different was to saute the onion and garlic with the sausage.
AMAZING! THIS IS MY GO TO RECIPE!
Made this with a few additional seasonings added. Delicious & hubby loved it. Will definitely make again.
Delicious! I made it according to recipe. I will definitely make it again.
Haven’t tasted it yet, looks good. Can’t wait for dinner tomorrow.
I misread the recipe and only used one jar of spaghetti sauce. Otherwise, I changed nothing. My whole family loved it - including my eight year old.

I'm sad to say I was disappointed with this recipe. I've made baked ziti many times but was never wowed by my own. I wanted to surprise my daughter with her favorite dish done better than ever. I think it may have been the raw onion and garlic mix in with the cheese mixture. I think it would have been better if I sauteed it with the ground sausage first. I read the reviews first as I always do with all of the recipes on this app because I find them helpful whether I agree or not with them.
This was super quick, easy, and tasted good. I’ll definitely make it again. I ended up using two whole jars of pasta sauce and used cottage cheese instead of ricotta.

I did the layers slightly differently than described in the recipe, but I used the exact ingredients. I mixed the ingredients except the pasta sauce and cheese. Then I made three layers of those three items. On the top I sprinkled some grated parmesan cheese. Delicious! We love baked pasta and this is one of the best.
I think I would have liked it better if the onion and garlic were cooked with the sausage. Also I like a nice crisp on top so I'd leave it uncovered longer than the 10 minutes.

This is a very good basic recipe as is, but a little bland. After reading other reviews, I made it again with the following changes. I used two pounds of Italian sausage and sautéed the onions with the sausage. I added more garlic and a 14.5 can of drained diced tomatoes with garlic to the ricotta cheese mixture. As others suggested, I doubled the amount of Italian cheese, using an 8 oz. package with each layer. Finally, I topped it with the basil as recommended and sprinkled shredded parmesan on the top. Spraying the underside of the aluminum foil so it doesn't stick to the cheese worked very well. Finally, we let it rest for 5-10 minutes while we tossed the Caesar salad and baked the garlic bread. Delicious! Next time, we are going to add mushrooms and sliced black olives to step it up even more.
I made this last night. It was OK, not great. It was bland. Not very flavorful. Next time I will add more herbs and spice to give it more zip.
I would cook the onions with the sausage before mixing the ingredients together. I would also suggest trying different sauces or making your own. The sauce I used was too bland for this recipe.
Great recipe! It serves plenty of people and it's tastes good as leftovers!
Good... I made as the recipe states & turned out yummy!
Delicious! Even my picky kids devoured it. I made as instructed, no changes and rave reviews from all
The family really enjoyed this. My only tip: use the pasta pot as your mixing bowl. You’ll have one less item to wash.
I have made this a couple of times and it has been amazing each time. Instead of spaghetti sauce I used Marinara sauce and spicy italian sausage. I also used italian seasoning along with the basil.
Great pasta dish! Cooked onion with the hot sausage. When cooking, needs more time than the 20 minutes posted. Cooked for 30 minutes & then 10-15 minutes after removing foil.
This recipe is awesome! Will definitely make again. Did not change anything except added the onion and garlic to sausage during the cooking process. Yum!
Only change we made was 1/2 lb beef 1/2 lb sausage and baked for 35 min. We like crispy mozzarella. Delish!

This was good. A little light on the sausage for my taste, but that can be rectified by using 1.5 lbs of sausage.

It's hard to find ziti where I shop, so I always use penne.

I'll definitely be making this again!

Super easy to make !
Great flavor

I’ve made this countless times. This is the best baked ziti recipe I could find. Never disappoints! I do prefer a little more oregano & basil than the recipe calls for though.
This was excellent made exactly as directed. My little kids loved it, and so did I! Just make sure you have a very large mixing bowl on hand!
This was really simple to make. Very tasty. I will definitely make it again.
My family loves this and requests it often!
I used turkey instead it made it taste better
Deliziosa ! Omitted the onion.

I made this last night, followed the directions exactly and I have to say that it was really good. The only exceptions was that I cooked it covered & uncovered longer than stated, I wanted it more cooked and browned on top. My whole family loved it, the cheese was stringy with each bite, there was just enough sausage and flavoring was just right. I think too that this recipe could also be a jumping off point for fancier versions with the addition of mushrooms, red crushed chili, olives, etc. I will be making this again and possibly trying some variations. Two thumbs up!
I am Italian; needs more garlic (maybe in powder form) salt & pepper, more spices in the form of an Italian bland...this was bland.
Good stuff! I was short on ricotta, so I made up the difference with sour cream and it worked just fine. Just putting that out there in case anyone needs a good substitute.

This is excellent!!

Delicious! My family loved it

Instead of bottled marinara, I used the "Best Ever Marinara" sauce recipe from this website as I had a batch frozen. Yum! We loved this. It was delicious. Thanks.

Delicious dish and tastes just as good as a leftover.
Simple, flavorful, freezes great. I like onion but if you are picky, cut it back. Cheese is also versatile. Definitely recommend that you spray the foil, the cheese will stick otherwise.

Delicious! I used marinara sauce, substituted Italian seasoning for the oregano, and omitted the onions (only because we have a family member who doesn't care for them). Everyone loved this recipe. Will definitely make this one again!

Excellent recipe! On accident, I only half the amount of noodles it called for (I thought the box was full). So, I used that and decreased the sauce to just 1 jar. It was perfect and delicious - maybe a little too saucy - but still great. No one noticed less noodles and I think I'll stick with it that way. It made less and didn't cause me to open another jar. We are a family of 5 and still had a couple of servings of leftovers.

Great base recipe for ziti. I increased the amount of sausage, sauteed the onion, and added garlic and green pepper. I also used two full bottles of pasta sauce (vodka sauce because I find it less acidic) and this was a hit! I'll definitely make this again.
Just what I needed during the lockdown.

I made two really minor changes - I didn't have ziti and used cavatappi pasta (which held up really well) and I cooked the onions down before adding them (cause I knew I'd prefer that). I'm honestly so tired of cooking during this quarantine - I mostly made this because it will make great leftovers! Bonus: it's really delicious!

Used Italian Sausage and since the package was 19 oz. that’s what I used. Browned the onions and garlic with the sausage. Sprayed the foil with Pam before covering the pan. Baked for 30 minutes before removing the foil and baked an additional 15 minutes. Quite good and easy to put together so will make again.

This is just like the lasagna my mother and grandmother made. We are Sicilian. My grandparents came right from Sicily. 

I put my own sauce plus 1 jar RAOS marinara. Added more sausage lots of onion,garlic and cooked it longer.... about 45 min at 350. afraid of egg not cooking and it came out of this world.
Awesome!!!!!!!!
Agree with others that the onions need to be cooked with the sausage first. They are basically raw. Also it took way longer than 20 minutes to really heat through all the way (closer to an hour).
Made it and it was amazing. The only change I made was adding cut-up sweet Italian sausage links.

Used Italian Chicken sausage. I sautéed the onion and garlic a little bit to soften first because my daughter freaks out if she finds an onion and I wasn't sure that a 1/2 hour in the oven would be enough to soften onions into obscurity! Delicious!

It was delicious. We added feta cheese

To move a little faster, I used a onion flavored pasta sauce. I also used a little more than one jar of pasta sauce - one jar just seemed a little light.

Amazing!!! This recipe makes A LOT but that's fine with me because I love leftovers (Nuke dinner in the microwave after a long day after work? Sold!) And my boyfriend who is 6'2" 220lbs eats like a baby elephant, so this is enough to feed us for half of the work week. The only changes I made was 1/2 jar more sauce because my boyfriend likes his pasta saucy and I used 3 tsp of italian seasoning instead of the basil and oregano (because I'm lazy and adding one spice instead of 2 was easier). Also I sauteed the onion with the sausage so it was soft and tender. But my boyfriend who is picky about pastas loved this!
So good I added ground beef also and a little extra ricotta

I have used the recipe a few times now. My family loves it! My husband asks me to make it every couple of weeks. I add a pound of hamburger. It's almost like eating my grandma's baked ziti. She passed 8 years ago, so this brings back fond memories of my childhood!
Excellent

His momma is 100% Italian from the old country and although this dish was easy, it is authentic especially if you use homemade sauce but I used quality bottled tomato and basil! I melted a stick of butter in the pasta! Gave it a richness! A serious keeper! I also made an extra batch for a friend who lost a loved one and had family in from out of town! Glad I came across the recipe today!
add all fresh cheese, instead of the bag cheese, it gets a better melt on it.

I made this after reading the review from CookinLovin. I incorporated the suggestions made and ended up with an incredible dish full of flavor. Thank you for the original recipe and thank you for the added recommendations.
Easy and simple to make. Great for the family or potluck. Either way everyone will love this dish. I’ve made this a few times and is a favorite amongst the family and friends.

Just not a good recipe as written, the onion needs to be cooked and the sauce to be heated with the sausage, onion, garlic and seasoning . Twenty minutes is way to short of a time. Thank you for posting this recipe. For us the crunchy onions weren’t appealing, thought hot italian sausage would help and more cheese on the top.

This was a great and simple recipe! Super easy to follow. If you’re at high altitude, I would suggest bumping up the heat to at least 375F for 30 minutes. I ended up going up 400F for about 15 minutes after instructed cook time because it wasn’t cooked all the way through (barely hit 100F internally)—gotta cook that egg thoroughly! Outside of the temperature adjustment, the meal tasted awesome and was well liked by my picky husband and six year old. I used Mazzetta basil and garlic marinara sauce to kick up the garlic flavor and I’ll do it again in the future!
This was very easy to make and full of flavor. I didn’t deviate from the recipe. It was a nice change from regular macaroni
I have made this several times and my family loves it. Plus it's so easy to make and clean up is easy breezy.
The only change I made was I added an extra pound of sausage. First for my family and they loved it!

Family favorite. The only change I made is that I make my own sauce. We are a family of 2, so this makes plenty to share with elderly family and neighbors. Everyone I have served it to loves it. I call it cheaters lasagna, as it is easier to put together.

Thoroughly enjoy. The proportion is excellent. For the homesteaders out there. Don't be afraid to use goat cheese instead of ricotta. It works great. And of coarse fresh is ALWAYS better. If you have fresh Italian herbs go nuts! I don't do canned sauce. home made Italian sauce is delish. I made it twice.

This is one of my all-time favorite dinners to make. It definitely takes some time and effort, but it is so absolutely worth it. Make sure the sausage is cooked well and you're in for one of the best dinners EVER!

My wife and I really enjoyed this. It was simple to put together and tasted great, even reheated the next day. We used freshly shredded mozzarella and parmesan cheese in place of the "shredded Italian cheese blend".
Easy meal for a quick tasty dinner.
